channel.title: pfSense on Computers
channel.description: Recent content in pfSense on Computers

item.title: pfSense, Squid and logging full URLs
item.description: By default the Squid package that pfSense installs will cut off the URLs if they are longer than a certain length. If you want it to log the full URL, add this to your squid.conf file. The config file says not to manually edit it, but I inserted this and restarted squid and everything continued working.

item.title: pfSense box update #3
item.description: I had a feeling using a cheap $7 flash driveas the boot OS might be a bad idea. Turns out it was. The drive started throwing errors after about a month and a half of running pfSense for my network. I didn’t want to go mechanical HDD for a 24x7 low power box so I decided on a OCZ Onyx 32 GB SSD. More than enough size and speed for how I am using it.
